name: professorially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is thought to be typical of or similar to a professor (= a teacher of high rank in a university or college): He was a tall, slim man, with professorially untidy black hair. He leaned back in his chair and pressed the fingertips of both his hands gently and somewhat professorially against each other.
More examplesFewer examples"I'm not a doctor," he declared, glaring professorially at me through his glasses.He was professorially dressed in a gold-and-red smoking jacket and grey pinstripe trousers.
